title: Bug 17825 - ControlExampleText beeps when SWT.MULTI is selected
description: Bug 17825 - ControlExampleText emits an incorrect beep sound when SWT.MULTI is selected.  This behavior seems to be unintended.
OB: When selecting SWT.MULTI, ControlExampleText emits a beep sound. Additionally, clicking on other buttons also triggers the beep sound.
EB: I expect that selecting SWT.MULTI should not trigger any beep sound. Instead, I hear a Windows 'ding' sound, which is an indication of an error.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch the ControlExampleText application.
2. Click on the 'SWT.MULTI' option.
3. Notice that the ControlExampleText emits a beep sound.
4. Click on other buttons.
5. Observe that the beep sound is triggered again.
